reviews.review_msg:
It's fine... Depends on the TA but I would complain that the modules are hard to navigate and incomplete.
Turnaround for marking isn't fast but isn't absurdly slow. There is lots of annotation returned to you. Marking is very very nitpicky. 
Sometimes the lecture recording and module instructions differ.

It was distance ed so your experience will heavily depend on the TM. The video lectures she posted were clearly made several years ago and had outdated course information on them, which was confusing. I'd recommend taking this class in person since qualitative research does not come easy, especially with little to no support online.

I asked for clarification around the research guideline and was simply told to just "follow the guidelines". I wouldn't be asking for clarification if I didn't read the guideline. We are not even given a template as other profs have given. I have never had an indifferent and dismissive prof and ta as this class. The prof herself is not accessible.

Basically have to teach yourself everything about qualitative research methods, no support from the prof and TA's don't have regular office hours. Avoid this prof for 321. TA's should hold officer hours.

distance-ed course:, the guidelines and lectures are so little and broad that you are dumbfounded on what to do. Many CRIM students are not adept at qualitative research, and this prof does not do a good job at all in preparing you for your final project. Her lectures are outdated, and does not cover content analysis.  DO NOT RECOMMEND

The online design of this class is fine, and the workload is manageable. The course is what you expect for a required upper-div course on theory. BUT Dr. Faubert herself is very difficult to communicate with. She lives in another province so email is the only way, and she is not good at it. She's short, dismissive, and disinterested. AVOID her.

Took this course through distance ed with TM Chantal. One of worst experiences ever. This TM marked quite harsh and nit-picked every small error, docking many marks for mistakes. The course could have gone a lot smoother if the TM was different.
not a fair marker at all! super boring too.

I honestly expected this course to be super difficult but Jacqueline made it as easy as possible. If you follow the guidelines and do basically everything thats required with some effort, achieving a B or anything higher is easily doable! Jacqueline is easily the best prof for online courses, also had her for 321 online. 10/10 would recommend!

I took it DE with TA Stephanie who is awesome! The workload is manageable (2 papers, a short presentation, 1 final). Discussion marks are somewhat ambiguous - I wrote paragraphs each week & combined all relevant readings, and was surprised by a lower mark - so beware. Overall, 321 w/ Jacqueline is a great option and it is fairly easy to do well!

I took this class online with her. I'm not a great writer at all, but the guidelines for the assignments are really straightforward. If you still need to take 321. I really reccomend taking the class onlike with her.

Not as hard as expected, but not "easy." Both papers (one 8 page; one 16 page) have clear guidelines to follow. Final exam (5 long answer, 1 essay) was based on the objectives found in each module. Make sure you participate, class avg for discussions was only 66% bc people thought it would be easy marks. Overall, definitely a good option for 321.

Tough, but fair. Class consists of weekly Canvas discussions (10%), a 2 - 3 page presentation (5%), two BBC discussions (10%), and three 8 - 10 page papers (75%). Expects a lot from students, but gives excellent feedback on the papers to help you improve each time. Not overly writing intensive compared to what others make it seem. Highly recommend

heard the class is suppose to be very difficult but it turned out to be fine. Easy. The final was pretty easy and not difficult to study for, i stressed way too much. Lots of online discussions though..weekly! Take the class she is very nice and i also had a nice TA asheka. I guess it depends on the ta you get too because they do all the marking.
bad marker

took CRIM 321 dis ed, the material is not hard to learn but is extremely boring. there are interesting topics for the essay but it depends on who your TA is because he/she does the marking. as for the final designed by jacqueline, it's not hard but you have to know A LOT. questions are not hard to answer, but they require a LOT of details to answer

of the 4 required crim classes, this was by far my favourite! (i took it dis-ed). it wasn't as hard as i had expected, and i thought the readings were interesting. i really liked this class... probably because i got to write an academic paper about graffiti!

Took two classes with her, crim 300 and 321 and both were great! TA's were awesome and participation marks are great mark boosters. Papers for crim 300 were tough, 321 was good because she didnt require you to do the research. Final exam was easy! All written.

Good distance ed. class. Papers require efforts. Final exam is easy-to-do. TA seems to be helpful. The online participation and presentation are point grabbers so do well in them to bump up your marks.

i took this class through dist ed.  Faubert laid out the guidelines and the requirements.  Other than than the TA, Marla, did all the grading and answering of the questions.  She does not give clarification prior to writing papers, online discussions, or tests.  Basically, you have to read the course package and figure things out.
Jacqueline is awesome! She is extremely helpful and encourages students to do well in the class by taking the time to post comments & feedback. Would definitely take another class w/ her again!
Had her for 230 last semester and she is AWESOME! very interesting...very engaging...VERY sad to see her go... =(

it's qualitative research...how interesting could that be? at lest she makes it more barrable. I took her through distance ed. usually profs dont do anything in dis-ed classes, she's different. she posts comments, and reads our comments, it's great to have a prof that cares so much! i recommend any class with her
She is fun and helpful teacher. Class was interesting.

she makes theory INTERESTING! I KNOW! i didnt think that was possible either! but the way she applies it to real life, it kind of makes you think abt theory in a whole new light. and come to think of it, we use theory everyday in our lives, we just dont realize it. love her course, would and am taking her again.

She tries to make the material as interesting as possible. She loves what she's doing and is passionate about what she's teaching.  She's a good speaker, but can get a little dry sometimes. The workload is very manageable and she marks pretty easily.
Great teacher, well organized, intesresting course, and i H8 history.(its a history of reactions to crime)I am currently taking another course with her.

Faubert tries her best to make the material interesting and easy to learn, which is all but impossible...Theory just sucks! She has everything going against her and yet she is personable, interested and helpful. Would take another class with her again.
Found these courses very interesting and knowledgeable. Jacqueline explains the class material very well, and she is approachable. She is always there to help her students out!

Great prof. Very nice & approachable. The 2 papers are very easy, I didn't read the text, and did very well in the class. But make sure you listen in LEC, so you know what's going on. LEC is quite boring though. I would take Faubert again. 7/10.
She's a good prof, a little boring, but livable.
Theory class so she has that going against her. Lectures were a little boring but in a smaller format class like crime 452- very interesting and very approachable. Takes the time to get to know you.
Give her chocolate pudding before your exam
Found the course interesting. Jacky really knows the class material. I wouldn't recommend this class if you're shy because speaking up is highly encouraged.
overall good prof... great lecturer
great prof. the class was a bore but her assignments were straightforward
lordy lordy shes a bit of flake, suffers from delusions of grandeur
she's very nice & helpful. she knows the crim theories well but her lectures are boring. this class is all about application of crim theories in papers.
Makes the theory class as good as it can get.  Unfortunately, it is still boring, but hey, it's a prereq!  A very pleasant, down-to-earth and easy to deal with person.  She will make time for you.

Well... it IS a theory course, but that aside it was tolerable and Jackie is a great lecturer, very receptive to questions and comments during lecture, and knows it forwards, backwards and inside out.
Slides can be printed out on WebCT. She really knows her stuff. The courseload was quite heavy, although a lot of the readings can be ignored. Lectures go on and on and on.....
She is very thorough in her lectures..but lectures exact same as notes received from WebCT. Material is difficult, and assignments are kind of hard too. Work hard and u should be fine.
Jackie is one of the best prof's I have ever had. She is very fair and objective.  She makes theory fun and interesting.  Definately take this class with her, you will not be dissapointed.
Boring lectures. She knows her stuff, but talks way too much. Assignments are fair and easy to follow.
She does an awesome job of trying to make theory interesting. Very good prof, highly recommend that you take this course with her cause theory can be SO boring.
She is an AWESOME teacher and she is very clear, fair minded, and tolerant of everybodys opinion

She loves criminology! She is extremely helpfull, and you get the impression that she can't wait to mark your paper. Best teacher ever to go see in office hours! She is the type of teacher that most departments could only dream of.

I like the fact that she is not bias and she explains all theories without promoting ones she likes and dissing ones she doesn't like.  She sticks to the facts and keeps her personal opinions out of class
She is an AMAZING teacher!  You actually leave her classes feeling as if you have learnt something!
Great prof, organized, knowledgeble and fair. Exams were fair and within my expectations

Jacky is a great prof. Her tests are very fair. She tests you on what you know rather than what you don't know. Partial lecture notes can be printed from WebCT. The material was interesting. Some of the articles were difficult to understand though.
great lecturer, easy exams and class
good lectures and easy exams
No Comments
Awesome, love the class
